intro: Chazaliella obovoidea subsp. rhytidophloea, commonly known as the rough bark chazaliella, is a member of the Rubiaceae family. It is a shrub characterized by its woody stems and elliptical to ovate leaves with a rough, fissured texture. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale yellow, followed by small, round fruits. It is native to southern Africa and thrives in dry, rocky habitats. Its unique bark and foliage make it a distinctive species within its genus.
